projects.title: WoodYou
projects.description: Creation of a logotype for WoodYou, a specialist in made-to-measure wooden objects, based on the Tangram principle.

section1.title: Step 1:
section1.subtitle: Defining the Message and Image
section1.description: This is the logotype creation process for WoodYou, a company whose main activity is the creation of made-to-measure laser-cut wooden objects for toys, decoration and communication media. This is a two-stage process. The first wave of three proposals allows us to better define with the customer the message and image that the company needs to convey. After selecting a lead and refining the direction to be taken, the second wave of proposals is made. In this project, in the first wave, we were able to discard proposal no. 1 because it was more suggestive of luxury codes, which is not WoodYou's target. We also discarded proposal no. 2 because it only targeted the playful world of toys, where WoodYou wanted to reach beyond that.

section2.title: Step 2:
section2.subtitle: Refine and select the Final Proposal
section2.description: Proposal no. 3 was chosen as the basis for the rest of the project, because it evoked both playfulness, with its reference to the "Tangram" silhouette game, and tailor-made modularity, while at the same time benefiting from the appeal of a mascot animal. The bear was chosen to evoke nature and the forest in a more mature way than other small animals usually associated with childhood, and because it reflects the values of the company's founders: boldness, strength and determination. It was proposal no. 1 of the second wave that was chosen by the client, for its balance of elementary modular forms, retaining the Tangram reference.

projects.title: My FrenChef

section1.subtitle: and Nutritious

section2.title: My Role:
section2.subtitle: Artistic Direction, UX, and UI
section2.description: On this project, my work encompasses both artistic direction and UX (user experience) and UI (user interface). As the artistic director, I ensure that MyFrenchef's visual identity is cohesive and appealing, reflecting the quality and expertise of the chefs. For UX, I design intuitive and pleasant user journeys, making it easier to navigate and use the app's various features. Regarding UI, I create clear and aesthetic interfaces, making the user experience not only functional but also visually pleasing. My goal is to ensure a smooth and enjoyable use of MyFrenchef, so users can focus on the joy of cooking and eating well.

projects.title: Selaliqua
projects.description: Selaliqua's e-commerce homepage redesign focuses on enhancing user engagement and conversion rates through a dialogue-driven approach that streamlines information and aligns with users' online reading behaviors.

section1.title: Through Dialogue:
section1.subtitle: Selaliqua's Homepage Redesign
section1.description: Selaliqua, an e-commerce client, sought to increase the conversion rate of their website traffic through a homepage redesign. The chosen approach was the "dialogue" method, treating the interface as an interlocutor that users engage with by asking questions. This method aimed to enhance the user dialogue by logically and smoothly organizing information. By simulating a natural conversation, the redesign ensures that users can easily find what they need, improving overall navigation and user satisfaction.

section2.title: Reducing Informational Noise
section2.subtitle: and Enhancing User Flow
section2.description: The dialogue approach effectively reduces informational noise that previously cluttered the homepage. This strategy considers the online reading habits of users, who typically scan pages in an "F" pattern, focusing on information placed at the top left, titles, and the initial words of paragraphs. By prioritizing key information in these areas, the redesigned homepage guides users efficiently, making important content more accessible and thereby improving the likelihood of conversions.

projects.title: Odysium
projects.description: Odysium is a company providing a medical concierge service and custom training programs for athletes. The project involved designing a PWA, it's flux and motion, from an existing graphic charter, to seamlessly integrate these two services.

section1.title: UX Process
section1.subtitle: for a Comprehensive PWA
section1.description: Building upon an existing graphic charter, the UX process for designing a Progressive Web App (PWA) for Odysium involved a meticulous and structured approach. The objective was to seamlessly combine the two primary services offered to Odysium's clients. The first service is a medical concierge tailored for athletes and their managers, providing them with personalized and accessible healthcare support. Understanding the unique needs and workflows of these users was crucial. Through user research, including interviews and surveys, we gathered insights into their daily routines, pain points, and preferences, which informed our design decisions.

section2.title: Integrating Training Programs
section2.subtitle: for Enhanced User Experience
section2.description: The second service focuses on customized training programs created by Odysium's coaches for the athletes they monitor. To integrate this into the PWA, we conducted a detailed analysis of how athletes interact with their training regimens. We employed user personas and journey mapping to visualize their experience and identify opportunities for improvement. Prototyping and user testing were essential to ensure that the interface was intuitive and engaging, allowing athletes to easily access and follow their training plans. By combining these two services into a cohesive PWA, we aimed to deliver a holistic and user-centered experience that enhances both the medical and training support for Odysium's clients.

section1.subtitle: the Graphic Identity

section2.title: Designing the Website

Given that the primary audience is predominantly elderly, the website's design focused on simplicity and readability, with intuitive navigation, larger text, and clear calls to action to ensure that users could easily access the information and services they needed.

projects.title: Haptic radar
projects.description: Fo/Va is a haptic prosthesis designed for visually impaired individuals, using an Arduino, infrared sensor, Raspberry Pi, and vibrators to provide spatial awareness through tactile feedback. Beyond visual impairment, it has broader applications, such as enhancing safety for workers in hazardous environments by detecting obstacles through vibrations.

section1.title: Development of the Fo/Va
section1.subtitle: Haptic Prosthesis
section1.description: Fo/Va is a haptic prosthesis project designed for visually impaired individuals. In 2015, I developed a prototype using an Arduino, an infrared sensor, a Raspberry Pi, and vibrators. The sensor's data is analyzed and converted into vibrations felt by the user. For instance, an obstacle on the left activates the left-side vibrators under the clothing, while an obstacle on the right triggers the right-side vibrators. The proximity of the obstacle is indicated by the intensity of the vibrations, providing users with spatial awareness through tactile feedback.

section2.title: Broader Applications
section2.subtitle: Beyond Visual Impairment
section2.description: The application of the Fo/Va haptic prosthesis extends beyond aiding the visually impaired. It can be utilized in various fields, such as industry. For example, a worker on a hazardous construction site can use this device to augment their vision, sensing the presence of moving masses behind them. This additional sensory input can enhance safety and awareness, demonstrating the versatility and potential of haptic technology in diverse environments.

projects.title: Paris Saint Germain

projects.title: Fov√©a
projects.description: Layout of my dissertation "of the prosthesis in the light of interaction design".

section1.title: Exploring the Intersection
section1.subtitle: of Design and Prosthetics
section1.description: The thesis delves into the evolving role of design in the development of prosthetics, highlighting how innovative design approaches can enhance the functionality and aesthetics of prosthetic devices. It examines the history and progression of prosthetic design, emphasizing the shift from purely functional devices to those that also consider the user‚Äôs comfort, psychological well-being, and social acceptance. By integrating principles of industrial design, ergonomics, and user-centered design, the research underscores the potential of well-designed prosthetics to significantly improve the quality of life for individuals with limb loss.

section2.title: Technological Integration
section2.subtitle: in Prosthetic Design
section2.description: The thesis further explores contemporary case studies where advanced technology and creative design intersect in prosthetic development. It analyzes the use of materials like lightweight composites, the incorporation of sensors and microprocessors for enhanced movement, and the application of 3D printing for custom-fitted prosthetics. Additionally, the research discusses the collaborative processes between designers, engineers, and users, illustrating how interdisciplinary efforts lead to more effective and personalized prosthetic solutions. The thesis concludes with insights into future trends and the potential for further innovation in the field of prosthetic design.

projects.title: Bone Hunt
projects.description: Bone Hunt, a 2013 student project, transforms museum visits into an interactive scavenger hunt using QR codes and mini-games to educate visitors about anatomical specimens, encouraging repeated engagement through seasonal updates.

section1.title: Concept and Design
section1.subtitle: of Bone Hunt
section1.description: Bone Hunt, a cherished student project from 2013, was created in response to a fictional call for proposals from the magnificent Mus√©e d'Anatomie Compar√©e de Paris, my favorite Museum. This interactive exploration experience turns museum visits into an engaging scavenger hunt. Visitors search for small QR codes embedded in bone illustrations throughout the museum. Scanning these codes with an app triggers mini-games, which, when completed, unlock detailed information about the specimen near the discovered "bone." This innovative approach aimed to make learning about anatomy fun and interactive.

section2.title: Enhancing Visitor Engagement
section2.subtitle: Through Gamification
section2.description: The experience is designed to retain visitor interest by allowing them to collect and preserve the unlocked information across multiple visits. Additionally, the hunts can be divided into seasons, offering new discoveries and maintaining the attraction for repeat visitors. This gamification of museum exploration not only enriches the educational experience but also encourages continuous engagement with the museum‚Äôs exhibits. The project's creative use of technology to blend education with entertainment exemplifies how interactive design can enhance visitor engagement in cultural institutions.

section2.title: Application

The color variations and pattern designs illustrate the monogram‚Äôs flexibility, showing its use in multiple contexts‚Äîfrom digital interfaces to printed materials. The repeated pattern of the monogram highlights its potential for creating visually engaging brand collateral. Additionally, the use of the monogram with the name "Gilles Peltier" in different color schemes demonstrates its effectiveness in reinforcing brand identity across diverse media.

projects.title: Booki
projects.description: My first contact with HTML and CSS. In this training project, I learned to create a responsive travel agency homepage using HTML and CSS, mastering the fundamentals of structured coding, layout design, and responsive principles. These skills are essential for advancing my career as a front-end developer, equipping me to deliver user-friendly web experiences across various devices and enhancing my adaptability in a dynamic digital landscape.

section1.title: What I Learned
section1.description:
Creating a travel agency's homepage using HTML and CSS provided me with practical experience in web development fundamentals. I learned to structure the HTML content effectively, organizing sections such as headers, navigation bars, content areas, and footers to ensure clarity and accessibility in the codebase. This process not only improved my understanding of semantic HTML but also reinforced the importance of structured coding practices for maintainability and scalability in larger projects.

CSS played a critical role in styling the webpage to mirror the design mockups accurately. Implementing layout techniques like flexbox and grid allowed me to create responsive designs that adapt seamlessly across different screen sizes‚Äîfrom mobile phones to large desktop monitors. Learning to use media queries enabled me to optimize the layout and styling based on device-specific characteristics, enhancing user experience by ensuring readability and usability across all devices.

Moreover, integrating custom interface components using HTML and CSS was instrumental in achieving design fidelity. From creating responsive navigation menus to implementing image carousels and interactive elements, I honed my skills in translating static design concepts into dynamic and functional web interfaces. This hands-on experience not only improved my proficiency in front-end development but also deepened my appreciation for the intricate balance between design aesthetics and technical implementation.

section2.title: Application
section2.subtitle: and Career Relevance
section2.description:
Mastering HTML and CSS integration for responsive web design is pivotal for advancing my career as a front-end developer. These foundational skills are essential for collaborating effectively with design teams and translating creative concepts into interactive web experiences that engage users across different devices.

Responsive design principles, learned through this project, are critical in today's digital landscape where users access websites from diverse platforms. By ensuring that web pages render correctly on mobile, tablet, and desktop screens, I enhance usability and accessibility, thereby improving user satisfaction and retention. This capability not only demonstrates my technical proficiency but also underscores my commitment to delivering high-quality, user-centric solutions in web development projects.

Furthermore, the ability to innovate with CSS frameworks and techniques underscores my adaptability and readiness to embrace new trends in web design. This agility is crucial for staying competitive in the fast-paced industry, where technological advancements continually redefine best practices and user expectations.

In conclusion, the skills acquired‚ÄîHTML and CSS proficiency, responsive design expertise, and a meticulous approach to web development‚Äîare foundational for my career growth as a front-end developer. They empower me to create compelling, user-friendly web experiences that meet the demands of modern digital environments, positioning me for success in diverse roles within the web development ecosystem.
